D522411-d-06-14-11-SKOL.Narrative: SKOL 109 JOB WAS PULLING TRAIN INTO WINFIELD IN PREPARATION TO BE RELIEVED BY 302 JOB.  THEY WERE DECREASING SPEED TO ALLOW FOR CREW CHANGE AND ENGINEER FELT A "SLIGHT TUG".  MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED ANDUPON INSPECTION BY CONDUCTOR IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE REAR SET OF LOCOMOTIVE TRUCKS AND 8 LOADED ROCK CARS HAD DERAILED.  THE CARS WERE RIDING ON THE WEB OF THE RAIL, EXPLAINING WHY THE CREW DIN'T "FEEL" THE DERAILMENT. INITIAL INVESTIGATION FAILED TO REVEAL A CONCLUSIVE CAUSE, AFTER CARS WERE MOVED FROM SITE, INSPECTION OF PRIVATE CROSSING SHOWED A LACK OF SUFFICIENT CROSS TIES. CAUSES DETERMINED TO BE: T102 CROSS LEVEL OF TRACK IRREGULAR & T105 INSUFFICIENT BALLAST SECTION, SECONDARY T205 DEFECTIVE OR MISSING CROSSTIES

AS THE RELEASE WENT THROUGHOUT THE TRAIN AND THE SLACK ROLLED IN SHOVING THE TRAIN FROM 6 MPH TO 9 MPH IN 1 SECOND.

DURING THIS MOVE THE REAR SET OF TRUCKS ON THE 12TH CAR GOT BEHIND THE SWITCH POINTS OF 6/7 SWITCH AND RESULTED IN DERAILMENT OF LINES 12 THROUGH15 CARS OF TRAIN. INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT SOMEONE AT CHEMICAL LIME HAD REMOVED THE LUG FROM THESWITCH AND LEFT SWITCH ROD FLOATING. DURING FURTHER INVESTIGATION IT WAS ALSO DISCOVERED THAT SHIMSWERE LEFT LYING ON THE CROSSTIE NEXT TO SWTICH AND TOP PLATE WAS OPENED. SWITCH WAS LINED CORRECTLYFOR CREW AS THEY WENT INTO THE PLANT ON TRACK #7 AND AS THEY DEPARTED, HOWEVER THE POINTS APPARENTLY OPEN UP DURING THE MOVE TO ALLOW WHEELS ON 12TH CAR TO DERAIL. CUSTOMER ACCEPTED RESPONSIBILITY.

AFTER INSPECTED THE TRACK IT WAS FOUND THAT THE FIRST CAR HAD DERAILED 4900 FEETPRIOR TO THE LOCATION WHERE THE TRAIN HAD BEEN STOPPED BY THE UNDESIRED EMERGENCY.  THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS THE ROBERTS STREET INTERLOCKING, FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT THE TRAIN CROSSED THE DRAWBRIDGE AND THEN IT ENCOUNTERED THE ONE/TWO SWITCH.  AT THE ONE/TWO SWITCH THE TRAIN WAS LINED FOR ONE TRACK BUT THE DERAILED CAR PUSHED OVER THRU TO TWO TRACK.  THIS APPEARS TO BE WHERE THE SECOND AND THIRD CARS WERE DERAILED.  DYNAMIC BRAKES ON LOCOMOTIVE WERE NOT RESPONDING AND WERE SURGING.

INVESTIGATION FOUND NO TRACK DEFECTS OR WHEEL MARKS ON TOP OFRAIL. AFTER REVIEWING DOWNLOADS, SHOED TRAIN HANDLING WAS CONSISTENT WITH TERRAIN AND TRACK SPEED AND TRACK WAS WITHIN FRA STANDARDS FOR CLASS OF RAIL 250 FEET NORTH TO THE NORTH OF POD AND 62 FEET TOTHE SOUTH OF POD. 2011060301-d-06-03-11-AR.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
2011060301-d-06-03-11-AR.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
2011060301-d-06-03-11-AR.Narrative: AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION, CONDUCTOR LOCHRIE WAS BACK IN THE MOMENTIVE YARD, EXACT LOCATION UNKNOWN.  ENGINEER BOWEN WAS ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE #400 WITH THE LONG HOOD AND 2 EMPTY TANKCARS BLOCKING HIS VEW OF THE LOADED CAR ON THE MAINLINE.  BRAKEMAN SESSOMS WAS HANDLING THE SWITCHING MOVE SHOVING BACK TO SPOT CARS ON THE CBP SIDING.  THE MOVE BEGAN WITH THE BRAKEMAN SHOVING TWO EMPTY CARS INTO THE CBP SIDING IN ORDER TO PULL OUT LOADED CAR TILX 252012.  AFTER COUPLING TO THE LOAD, SESSOMS PULLED THE CAR OUT RELEASING THE HANDBRAKE BUT NOT COUPLING AIR.  AFTER PULLING THROUGH THE SWITCH HE SHOVED THE LOADED CAR IN TO THE CLEAR AND CUT OFF THE CAR ON THE MAINLINE WHICH IS ON ASLIGHT DOWNGRADE, FAILING TO SET THE HANDBRAKE.  THE EMPTY CARS WERE AGAIN PULLED BY THE SWITCH ANDTHE SWITCH ALIGNED BACK TO THE SIDING.  SESSOMS THEN BEGAN SHOVING THE EMPTY CARS IN TO SPOT FAILING TO NOTICE THE LOADED CAR WAS SLOWLY ROLLING TOWARD HIS TRAIN AND FOULING THE SWITCH.  THE RIGHT CORNER OF THE B END OF TILX252012 STRUCK THE LEFT CORNER OF THE B END OF TCIX 235019.  NEITHER CAR DERAILED AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

710908-d-06-04-11-WC.Narrative: L55081-03 TRAVELLING AT 23 MPH WHEN AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY APPLICATION WAS EXPERIENCED. THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND 15 CARS DERAILED. ALL CARS WERE DERAILED IN THE UPRIGHT POSITION WITH 4 CARSSIDEWAYS. NO HAZARDOUS COMMODITIES ARE INVOLVED, NO LEAKS AND NO INJURIES. CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT ISSTILL UNDER INVESTIGATION. CARS DERAILED: GTW 188174, GTW 187836, CN 187836, CN 187070, NOKL 380775, GTW 187797, GTW 187817, CN187005, GTW 188252, GTW 187794, GTW 188281, CN 187849, GTW 188265, BCOL860687, BCOL 11222. INVESTIGATION WAS COMPLETED AND NO DIRECT CAUSE COULD BE DETERMINED. THE LOCOMOTIVES WERE DOWNLOADED WITH NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN. THE ON-SITE INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT SOME TIE WERE INPOOR SHAPE IN AND AROUND THE SWAMP ARE OF THE DERAILMENT WITH ONE CAR AT THE END OF THE DERAILEMENTSITE WITH THE AIR HOSE SEPARATED. DUE TO THE DERAILMENT SITE BEING IN A SWAMP AREA, A DEFINITE CAUSE COULD NOT BE FOUND.

711050-d-06-05-11-WC.Narrative: M34371-04 WAS DEPARTING MARKHAM YARD ON THOROUGHFARE 3 WHEN THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP AND IT WAS FOUND THAT 39 CARS HAD DERAILED. IT IS EVIDENT THAT LATERAL FORCES CAUSED THE RAIL TO CANT ON TANGENT TRACK, THE TIE CONDITION IS POOR, RATED FOR CLASS 1 SPEED. THERE HAS BEEN EVIDENCE OF LATERAL FORCES,NOT GENERATED BY TRAIN HANDLING, BUT THERE HAD TO BE EITHER LATERAL FORCES OR WHEEL LIFT. EMPTY EQUIPMENT NORMALLY LIFTS, AS IT IS NOT HEAVY ENOUGH TO GENERATE 50,000 POUNDS OF LATERAL FORCES TO TURNTHE RAIL. 000091160-d-06-30-11-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Track damage caused by non-railroad interference with track structure
000091160-d-06-30-11-CSX.Accident Cause: Track damage caused by non-railroad interference with track structure
000091160-d-06-30-11-CSX.Narrative: Q23530 ENCOUNTERED A DISTURBANCE IN THE ROADBED AT MILEPOST 000015.2. THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING INDYNAMIC BRAKE AND APPLIED THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE TO THE TRAIN SHORTLY AFTER THE ENGINE WENT THROUGH THEAREA THAT WAS DISTURBED. THE ENGINES AND THE FIRST 7 CARS IN THEIR TRAIN CLEARED THE TRACK DISTURBANCE BEFORE DERAILING THE 8TH THROUGH 25TH CARS IN A GENERAL PILE-UP. APPROXIMATELY 10 MINUTES EARLIER, Q22028 PASSED OVER THE SAME AREA IN A NORTHBOUND DIRECTION AND NO IRREGULARITIES WERE SEEN. WITNESSES AT THE SCENE REPORTED TO POLICE OFFICERS AND OTHER RR EMPLOYEES THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN AROUND IN A GRAVEL AREA NEXT TO THE TRACK AT MILEPOST 15.2 AND STRUCK THE TRACK WITHTHE REAR OF HIS TRAILER. ONE WITNESS CALLED THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO REPORT THEINCIDENT AND THE SECOND WITNESS CALLED IN TO THE BULLITT COUNTY SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT TO REPORT THE TRACTOR TRAILER STRIKING THE RAIL. THIS OCCURRED BETWEEN 1515 AND 1530. THE DVR SHOWS THE TRACTOR TRAILER LEAVING FROM THE GRAVEL AREA ADJACENT TO THE TRACK SHOWS THE AREA OF TRACK THAT WAS MISALIGNED DUE TO THE TRACTOR TRAILER BACKING INTO THE RAIL. WITNESSES ALSO STATED THAT THE TRACTOR TRAILER HADJUST CLEARED THE TRACK PRIOR TO THE ARRIVAL OF Q23530. VIDEO FROM THE DVR CONFIRMS THE CAUSE CODE AND THE WITNESSES ACCOUNT OF THE OUTSIDE INTERFERENCE WITH THE TRACK STRUCTURE BY THE OPERATOR OF THETRACTOR TRAILER.
